snippet: Its report blamed a continuing influx of fighters and weaponry from Russia as the major obstacle to peace.
abstract: United Nations reports that nearly 8,000 people have died in eastern Ukraine conflict since it began in April 2014, and blames  influx of Russian fighters and armaments as impediment to peace process.
lead_paragraph: Its report blamed a continuing influx of fighters and weaponry from Russia as the major obstacle to peace.

headline.main: Nearly 8,000 Killed in Ukraine Conflict, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: Close to 8,000 Have Been Killed in Ukraine Conflict, United Nations Says
